properties.title: Basic HTML Table with implicit columns
properties.description: When no columns prop is given, the table will automatically determine the columns and column headers based on the keys of data.

properties.title: Basic HTML Table with simple columns
properties.description: When the columns prop contains strings, the associated data will be shown in the data in the order provided.

properties.title: Sortable HTML Table with explicit columns
properties.description: The columns prop defines the properties of each column. This allows for more complex table behavior, such as sorting.

properties.title: Basic Flex Table
Sortable Flex Table
Table row hover
properties.description: Adding .tr-hover to a specific table row or the table element itself will add the hover effect.

properties.title: Table cell hover
properties.description: Adding .td-hover to the table element will allow the user to highlight individual cells.

properties.title: Table border modifiers
properties.description: Remove all of the internal horizontal borders with class .tr-no-h-borders applied to the table row or the table element.

properties.title: No external borders
properties.description: No external borders to rows using class .table-no-ext-borders on the table element.

properties.title: No borders
properties.description: No borders to rows using class .table-no-borders on the table element.

children.value: component has a limited feature-set. Users can compose Tables with additional features by using plugins.
Here are the plugins provided by Pivotal UI:
A composed table can be created by composing one or more of the above plugins:
The following examples demonstrate the individual usage of each of the above plugins.

properties.title: Flex
properties.description: Flex tables are composed of div tags.

properties.title: Cell links (requires FlexTable)
properties.description: Each cell in a column of a FlexTable can be an <a> tag. In this example, the first column links to the top of this section, and the last column links to the top of this page.

properties.title: Cell className
properties.description: Each cell in a column can have custom classes. In this example, the first column has the h4 class applied.

properties.title: Row className
properties.description: A className can be provided to a row element. In this example, the body rows are given the h4 class.

properties.title: Cell ellipsis (requires FlexTable)
properties.description: Each cell in a column of a FlexTable can be set to trail off with an ellipsis when the contents exceed the available space. In this example, the first column has the type-ellipsis class applied.

properties.title: Cell onClick
properties.description: Each cell in a column can be provided an onClick handler. In this example, the first column has the will show an alert with contextual information for the row when clicked.

properties.title: Custom renderTdChildren function
properties.description: Each cell in a column can provide a custom render function. In this example, the first column has a custom child render function that capitalizes its text.

properties.title: Custom renderThChildren function
properties.description: Each header in a column can provide a custom render function. In this example, the first header has a custom child render function that capitalizes its text.

properties.title: Cell tooltip
properties.description: Each cell in a column can have a tooltip. In this example, the first column has a tooltip that displays its text, reversed. The header tooltip has a dark theme, while the body cell tooltips have a light theme.

properties.title: Cell width
properties.description: Each cell in a column can have a fixed width. In this example, the cells in the first column are 100px wide, and the cells in the second column are 200px. The cells in the final column use the remaining space.

properties.title: Footer row
properties.description: A custom footer row can be provided.

properties.title: Row drawer (requires FlexTable)
properties.description: When body rows of a FlexTable are clicked, drawer content is revealed.

properties.title: Row links (requires FlexTable)
properties.description: An entire row of a FlexTable can be rendered as an <a> tag. In this example, clicking the first body row links to Table usage.

properties.title: Sorting
properties.description: A table can be sorted ascending or descending by a given column by clicking on that column's header.

properties.title: Scrollable table body (requires FlexTable)
properties.description: When scrollable and tbodyHeight="<some height>", the table body will scroll when that height is exceeded.
